section.name: soapUI TestSteps
section.p: A soapUI TestCase consists of an arbitrary number of TestSteps that are executed after eachother. The following types of steps are available;

tr.td: Sends a SOAP request and allows the response to be validated using a variety of assertions.
Executes a REST Request to a Resource defined in the project
Used for transferring property values between two test steps.
Runs a Groovy script that can do more or less "anything".
Used for defining global properties that can be read from an external source.
Allows any number of conditional jumps in the TestCase execution path. Conditions are specified as XPath expression and applied to the previous request steps response.
Pauses a TestCase run for the specified number of milliseconds
Runs another TestCase from within an existing one
Waits/Listens for an incoming SOAP Request that can be validated and return a mock response
Reads external data to be used as input to requests, etc - soapUI pro only
Used together with a DataSource to specify looping for external data rows - soapUI pro only
Writes properties to an external storage - soapUI pro only
Generates property values - soapUI Pro only

div.p: In soapUI Pro you have additional powerful TestSteps. For example, you can connect your test to a database to feed your Web Service Tests.
soapUI Pro contains productivity enhancements as well as offers Professional World Class support.

img.alt: Try soapUI pro to soap test

section.p: Each TestStep in a TestCase exposes a number of properties which can be read, written, or modified by other TestSteps, for example a Groovy Script step can read the "response" property of a Request Step and take some action depending on its value, see Property Expansion for details and examples.

subsection.name: Common TestStep Actions
subsection.p:
Each TestStep has a popup-menu in the navigator and TestCase editor containing a number of common and step-specific actions:
Open Editor - opens the associated TestStep editor (if available)
Disable/Enable TestStep - disables/enables the TestStep for execution
Insert Step -> - shows a list of insertable test-steps at the current position
Rename - prompts to rename the selected step
Delete - prompts to delete the selected step
Clone TestStep - prompts to clone the selected step (see below)
Move Step Up - moves the selected step up one position in the list (this can also be performed with Ctrl-Up)
Move Step Down - moves the selected step down one position in the list (this can also be performed with Ctrl-Down)
- specific actions - - TestStep specific actions
Online Help - displays a TestStep specific page in a browser
